unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Library Survey on Child Height and Shoe Size
question_text:
Suppose a random sample of size $n = 40\text{ children}$ were taken at a local library, where they were asked their shoe size and age.
What $r$ value and test statistic would be most likely to occur when performing a linear regression $T$-test of $H_0: B = 0$ vs. $H_a: B \gt 0$?
solution:
One would expect a strong, positive correlation between a child’s shoe size and age. Therefore, $r$ should be positive and fairly high, between $0.7$ and $1$.

The test statistic should be fairly high and positive. Since there is a strong positive linear relationship between a child’s height and age, one would expect the test results to show a test statistic value many standard deviations above the mean for a sample this large.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
